name: clawsig-protocol-v0.2
description: Clawsig Protocol v0.2 candidate stories. These are identified but not scheduled — v0.1 must see real adoption first.

userStories.title: Protocol-level rate limiting semantics
userStories.description: Define how proof bundles express and verify rate limits — per-agent, per-model, per-tool. Allows verifiers to detect burst abuse without online state.
acceptanceCriteria: Rate limit claims in proof bundle metadata
Verifier checks claim consistency across bundles from same agent
Conformance vectors for rate limit violations
userStories.notes: Candidate. Blocked on real adoption data to inform the right semantics.

userStories.title: Multi-party receipt co-signing
userStories.description: Allow receipts to carry multiple signatures — agent + proxy + human approver. Enables multi-party attestation without central trust.
userStories.notes: Candidate. Useful for high-stakes autonomous agent deployments.

userStories.title: Receipt expiry / TTL semantics
userStories.description: Define how proof bundles and individual receipts express validity windows. Verifiers reject expired receipts.
acceptanceCriteria: TTL field in receipt envelope schema (optional)
Grace period semantics for clock skew
userStories.notes: Candidate. Needed for compliance regimes that require fresh attestations.

userStories.title: Selective disclosure for tool receipt arguments
userStories.description: Allow tool receipts to optionally reveal specific argument fields while keeping others hashed. Uses structured commitment schemes.
acceptanceCriteria: Verifier validates partial disclosure against digest
userStories.notes: Candidate. Enables audit use cases that need to see 'which file was read' without seeing 'what was in it'.

userStories.title: Aggregate proof bundles (bundle-of-bundles)
userStories.description: Define a composition format for fleet-level verification — a single signed envelope containing multiple proof bundles from different agents.
acceptanceCriteria: Aggregate bundle schema with member bundle references
Verifier validates aggregate signature + each member
Fleet summary statistics in aggregate metadata
userStories.notes: Candidate. Needed for enterprise fleet dashboards and compliance reporting across agent pools.
